text.section: The local health officers of two or more counties may join together as a region to apply for a Local Public Health Cancer Grant.

The Department may require that two or more counties join together as a region to apply for a Local Public Health Cancer Grant if the Department determines that:
It would be cost-effective to fund cancer prevention, education, screening, and treatment programs for targeted cancers on a regional basis; and
It would serve the public health interests of the counties to fund cancer prevention, education, screening, and treatment programs for targeted cancers on a regional basis.

The amount of a Local Public Health Cancer Grant that is distributed to a region under this section shall be equal to the sum of the Local Public Health Cancer Grants that otherwise would have been distributed to each county under the formula established under § 13-1108 of this subtitle.
